intro: Alomia cinerea, commonly known as the pale alomia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Alomia cinerea is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
